data.title: Dinner Party
data.statement:
You are organizing a dinner party and want to ensure there's something that everyone will enjoy. 

You have asked the [[N]] guests about their favorite foods, and you want to know which foods, if any, are liked by all the guests. 

List them <<in alphabetical order>>, but if there are none, print out {{None}}.

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
2
pasta burger ramen
burger salad sushi

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
2
pizza pasta chicken
burger pizza ramen

data.constraints:
2 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 10
Each guest has at most 10 favorite foods.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read favorites:string(100)
write foods
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of guests.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A list of space-separated lowercase strings - the favorite foods of a guest.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A list of space-separated strings: containing the names of the foods that all guests like in alphabetical order. If no such food exists, this should be {{None}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are organizing a dinner party and want to ensure there's something that everyone will enjoy.

You have asked the N guests about their favorite foods, and you want to know which foods, if any, are liked by all the guests.

List them in alphabetical order, but if there are none, print out None.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of guests.
Next N lines: A list of space-separated lowercase strings - the favorite foods of a guest.
Output
Line 1: A list of space-separated strings: containing the names of the foods that all guests like in alphabetical order. If no such food exists, this should be None.
Constraints
2 ≤ N ≤ 10
Each guest has at most 10 favorite foods.
Example
Input
2
pasta burger ramen
burger salad sushi
Output
burger
